member.name: T:NDceRpc.Client
member.summary: Provides a connection-based wrapper around the RPC client

member.name: M:NDceRpc.Client.Dispose
member.summary: Disconnects the client and frees any resources.

member.name: M:NDceRpc.Client.connect
member.summary: Connects the client; however, this is a soft-connection and validation of the connection will not take place until the first call is attempted.

member.name: M:NDceRpc.Client.AuthenticateAs(System.Net.NetworkCredential)
member.summary: Adds authentication information to the client, use the static Self to authenticate as the currently logged on Windows user.

member.name: M:NDceRpc.Client.AuthenticateAs(System.String,System.Net.NetworkCredential)
member.summary: Adds authentication information to the client, use the static Self to authenticate as the currently logged on Windows user.

member.name: M:NDceRpc.Client.AuthenticateAs(System.String,System.Net.NetworkCredential,NDceRpc.Interop.RpcProtectionLevel,NDceRpc.Interop.RpcAuthentication[])
member.summary: Adds authentication information to the client, use the static Self to authenticate as the currently logged on Windows user. This overload allows you to specify the privacy level and authentication types to try. Normally these default to RPC_C_PROTECT_LEVEL_PKT_PRIVACY, and both RPC_C_AUTHN_GSS_NEGOTIATE or RPC_C_AUTHN_WINNT if that fails. If credentials is null, or is the Anonymous user, RPC_C_PROTECT_LEVEL_DEFAULT and RPC_C_AUTHN_NONE are used instead.

member.name: P:NDceRpc.Client.Protocol
member.summary: The protocol that was provided to the constructor

member.name: P:NDceRpc.Client.Anonymous
member.summary: Returns a constant NetworkCredential that represents the Anonymous user

member.name: P:NDceRpc.Client.Self
member.summary: Returns a constant NetworkCredential that represents the current Windows user

member.name: T:NDceRpc.Interop.RpcHandle
member.summary: Is thread safe.

member.name: T:NDceRpc.Interop.RpcProtectionLevel
member.summary: The protection level of the communications, RPC_C_PROTECT_LEVEL_PKT_PRIVACY is the default for authenticated communications.

member.summary: An interface that provide contextual information about the client within an Rpc server call

member.summary: Returns a disposable context that is used to impersonate the calling user

member.summary: Returns true if the caller is using LRPC

member.name: P:NDceRpc.IRpcCallInfo.ClientAddress
member.summary: Returns a most random set of bytes, undocumented Win32 value.

member.summary: Defines the type of the procol being used in the communication, unavailable on Windows XP

member.name: P:NDceRpc.IRpcCallInfo.ProtectionLevel
member.summary: Returns the packet protection level of the communications

member.name: P:NDceRpc.IRpcCallInfo.AuthenticationLevel
member.summary: Returns the authentication level of the connection

member.name: P:NDceRpc.IRpcCallInfo.ClientPid
member.summary: Returns the ProcessId of the LRPC caller, may not be valid on all platforms

member.name: P:NDceRpc.IRpcCallInfo.IsAuthenticated
member.summary: Returns true if the caller has authenticated as a user

member.name: P:NDceRpc.IRpcCallInfo.ClientPrincipalName
member.summary: Returns the client user name if authenticated, not available on WinXP

member.name: P:NDceRpc.IRpcCallInfo.ClientUser
member.summary: Returns the identity of the client user or Anonymous if unauthenticated

member.name: P:NDceRpc.IRpcCallInfo.IsImpersonating
member.summary: Returns true if already impersonating the caller

member.summary: Server side transport interface.

member.name: T:NDceRpc.Interop.RpcAuthentication
member.summary: The authentication type to be used for connection, GSS_NEGOTIATE / WINNT are the most common. Be aware that GSS_NEGOTIATE is not available unless the machin is a member of a domain that is not running WinNT (or in legacy mode).

member.name: T:NDceRpc.Guard
member.summary: provides a set of runtime validations for inputs

member.name: M:NDceRpc.Guard.Assert``1(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Verifies that the condition is true and if it fails constructs the specified type of exception and throws.

member.name: M:NDceRpc.Guard.Assert``1(System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: Verifies that the condition is true and if it fails constructs the specified type of exception with any arguments provided and throws.

member.name: M:NDceRpc.Guard.NotNull``1(``0)
member.summary: Verifies that value is not null and returns the value or throws ArgumentNullException

member.name: M:NDceRpc.Guard.Assert(NDceRpc.Interop.RPC_STATUS)
member.summary: Asserts that the argument is set to RPC_STATUS.RPC_S_OK or throws a new exception.

member.name: T:NDceRpc.Interop.Async.RPC_ASYNC_STATE
member.summary: The structure holds the state of an asynchronous remote procedure call. Used to wait for, query, reply to, or cancel asynchronous calls.

member.name: F:NDceRpc.Interop.Async.RPC_ASYNC_STATE.Size
member.summary: Size of this structure, in bytes. The environment sets this member when is called. Do not modify this member.

member.name: F:NDceRpc.Interop.Async.RPC_ASYNC_STATE.Signature
member.summary: The run-time environment sets this member when is called. Do not modify this member.

member.name: F:NDceRpc.Interop.Async.RPC_ASYNC_STATE.Lock
member.summary: The run-time environment sets this member when is called. Do not modify this member.

member.name: F:NDceRpc.Interop.Async.RPC_ASYNC_STATE.StubInfo
member.summary: Reserved for use by the stubs. Do not use this member.

member.name: F:NDceRpc.Interop.Async.RPC_ASYNC_STATE.UserInfo
member.summary: Use this member for any application-specific information that you want to keep track of in this structure.

member.name: F:NDceRpc.Interop.Async.RPC_ASYNC_STATE.RuntimeInfo
member.summary: Reserved for use by the RPC run-time environment. Do not use this member.

member.name: F:NDceRpc.Interop.Async.RPC_ASYNC_STATE.Reserved
member.summary: Reserved for compatibility with future versions, if any. Do not use this member.

member.name: T:NDceRpc.Interop.RpcProtseq
member.summary: Defines the various types of protocols that are supported by Win32 RPC

member.name: F:NDceRpc.Interop.RpcProtseq.ncacn_nb_tcp
member.summary: Connection-oriented NetBIOS over Transmission Control Protocol (TCP) Client only: MS-DOS, Windows 3.x Client and Server: Windows Server 2003, Windows XP, Windows 2000, Windows NT

member.name: F:NDceRpc.Interop.RpcProtseq.ncacn_nb_ipx
member.summary: Connection-oriented NetBIOS over Internet Packet Exchange (IPX) Client only: MS-DOS, Windows 3.x Client and Server: Windows Server 2003, Windows XP, Windows 2000, Windows NT

member.name: F:NDceRpc.Interop.RpcProtseq.ncacn_nb_nb
member.summary: Connection-oriented NetBIOS Enhanced User Interface (NetBEUI) Client only: MS-DOS, Windows 3.x Client and Server: Windows Server 2003, Windows XP, Windows 2000, Windows NT, Windows Me, Windows 98, Windows 95

member.name: F:NDceRpc.Interop.RpcProtseq.ncacn_ip_tcp
member.summary: Connection-oriented Transmission Control Protocol/Internet Protocol (TCP/IP) Client only: MS-DOS, Windows 3.x, and Apple Macintosh Client and Server: Windows Server 2003, Windows XP, Windows 2000, Windows NT, Windows Me, Windows 98, Windows 95

member.name: F:NDceRpc.Interop.RpcProtseq.ncacn_np
member.summary: Connection-oriented named pipes Client only: MS-DOS, Windows 3.x, Windows 95 Client and Server: Windows Server 2003, Windows XP, Windows 2000, Windows NT

member.name: F:NDceRpc.Interop.RpcProtseq.ncacn_spx
member.summary: Connection-oriented Sequenced Packet Exchange (SPX) Client only: MS-DOS, Windows 3.x Client and Server: Windows Server 2003, Windows XP, Windows 2000, Windows NT, Windows Me, Windows 98, Windows 95

member.name: F:NDceRpc.Interop.RpcProtseq.ncacn_dnet_nsp
member.summary: Connection-oriented DECnet transport Client only: MS-DOS, Windows 3.x

member.name: F:NDceRpc.Interop.RpcProtseq.ncacn_at_dsp
member.summary: Connection-oriented AppleTalk DSP Client: Apple Macintosh Server: Windows Server 2003, Windows XP, Windows 2000, Windows NT

member.name: F:NDceRpc.Interop.RpcProtseq.ncacn_vns_spp
member.summary: Connection-oriented Vines scalable parallel processing (SPP) transport Client only: MS-DOS, Windows 3.x Client and Server: Windows Server 2003, Windows XP, Windows 2000, Windows NT

member.name: F:NDceRpc.Interop.RpcProtseq.ncadg_ip_udp
member.summary: Datagram (connectionless) User Datagram Protocol/Internet Protocol (UDP/IP) Client only: MS-DOS, Windows 3.x Client and Server: Windows Server 2003, Windows XP, Windows 2000, Windows NT

member.name: F:NDceRpc.Interop.RpcProtseq.ncadg_ipx
member.summary: Datagram (connectionless) IPX Client only: MS-DOS, Windows 3.x Client and Server: Windows Server 2003, Windows XP, Windows 2000, Windows NT

member.name: F:NDceRpc.Interop.RpcProtseq.ncadg_mq
member.summary: Datagram (connectionless) over the Microsoft Message Queue Server (MSMQ) Client only: Windows Me/98/95 Client and Server: Windows Server 2003, Windows XP, Windows 2000, Windows NT Server 4.0 with SP3 and later

member.name: F:NDceRpc.Interop.RpcProtseq.ncacn_http
member.summary: Connection-oriented TCP/IP using Microsoft Internet Information Server as HTTP proxy Client only: Windows Me/98/95 Client and Server: Windows Server 2003, Windows XP, Windows 2000

member.name: F:NDceRpc.Interop.RpcProtseq.ncalrpc
member.summary: Local procedure call Client and Server: Windows Server 2003, Windows XP, Windows 2000, Windows NT, Windows Me, Windows 98, Windows 95

member.summary: The interface Id the service is using

member.name: M:NDceRpc.ExplicitBytes.ExplicitBytesServer.#ctor(System.Guid)
member.summary: Constructs an RPC server for the given interface guid, the guid is used to identify multiple rpc servers/services within a single process.

member.name: M:NDceRpc.ExplicitBytes.ExplicitBytesServer.Execute(NDceRpc.IRpcCallInfo,System.Byte[])
member.summary: Can be over-ridden in a derived class to handle the incomming RPC request, or you can subscribe to the OnExecute event.

member.name: E:NDceRpc.ExplicitBytes.ExplicitBytesServer.OnExecute
member.summary: Allows a single subscription to this event to handle incomming requests rather than deriving from and overriding the Execute call.

member.name: T:NDceRpc.Interop.InterfacRegistrationFlags
member.summary: http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/aa373954.aspx

member.name: F:NDceRpc.Interop.InterfacRegistrationFlags.RPC_IF_ALLOW_CALLBACKS_WITH_NO_AUTH
member.summary: When this interface flag is registered, the RPC runtime invokes the registered security callback for all calls, regardless of identity, protocol sequence, or authentication level of the client. This flag is allowed only when a security callback is registered. Note This flag is available starting with Windows XP with SP2 and Windows Server 2003 with SP1. When this flag is not set, RPC automatically filters all unauthenticated calls before they reach the security callback.
